docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 The Food and Drug Adminitra tion reinstated today its total ban on cyclamates, the artificial sweetening chemicals that had been found to cause a cancer in rats.

headline.main: Full Cyclamate Ban Reimposed; F.D.A. Doubts Value in Dieting; F.D.A. REIMPOSES CYCLAMATES BAN

docs.abstract: FDA reimposes total ban on cyclamate use, effective Sept 1, after its Med Advisory Group on Cyclamate concludes use of diet foods containing cyclamate is of little value in weight contral; FDA spokesman holds evidence shows cyclamate does not aid diabetics and thus cannot be sold as over-the-counter drug; says FDA will seize products containing cyclamate after Sept 1 if new policy is disregarded but holds some such products will probably be sold for several mos; Natl Canners Assn estimates members will lose $30- to $35-million as result of new order
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14  The Food and Drug Adminitra  tion reinstated today its total ban on cyclamates, the artificial sweetening chemicals that had been found to cause a cancer in rats.

byline.original: By RICHARD D. LYONS Special to The New York Times
